page.title: 16Smithfield market Denbigh
page.content: Our first impression of{Smithfield market was of a{very busy}scene with {Land-Rovers + trailers and large {cattle wagons}constantly turning on to the large car park. Signs on the wagons showed that people had {travelled}from all over{N.Wales}to attend this{Fat stock market}held every{Tuesday.}Animals were unloaded and the{Beef cattle, sheep and lambs taken to be{weighed}and{graded}before being penned ready for{auction,}mainly to{butchers}and{wholesalers. Small groups of farmers are scattered about the market place engaged in conversation. Such topics as milk quotas, grant reductions, market prices, weather conditions and the odd bargain are regularly discussed -the market place being the ideal place for mixing business with pleasure.
